page.title: 06OTTERBOURNE CARNIVAL WEEK
page.content: {Carnival Week}started after the Queen's Silver Jubilee in 1977, when they had all the fun of the fair that we have today. Carnival Week is held at the end of June or the beginning of July. It is a time when people enjoy themselves and hopefully give generously to a good cause. This year it is the Langley House Trust. Every year a new Carnival queen is selected and also two Carnival Princesses. If you become one of these you are presented with a headband and lettered sash.The Queen receives a card and Â£10 00, the Princesses Â£5 00.One of their duties is to attend all the events in the week such as the Old Tyme Music Hall, Knock Out Cricket, Songs of Praise, Children's Disco, Bingo, Brass Band Concert,Modern Sequence Dancing Evening, and the Carnival Procession
